intro: Solanum indicum var. micranthum, commonly known as the Indian nightshade, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with simple, ovate leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to violet. Its berries are usually yellow or red when mature and contain toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals.
